title.rendered: Find Rooms for Rent in Downtown Brooklyn

content.rendered:
Looking for rooms for rent in Downtown Brooklyn? In this city guide, you’ll not only find the average rent in Downtown Brooklyn but also the essentials to help you decide if it’s the place for you. Bookmark this city guide to get the most out of the area when you move here!

Presently, Downtown Brooklyn is known for its courthouses, government, and office buildings, residentiaries, and developing educational centers. For this reason, it’s the third-largest CBD of NYC. There are plenty of parks and restaurants in Downtown Brooklyn you can visit to get a feel for why the locals love the area.

Related: You Know You Live in Brooklyn When…

Where is Downtown Brooklyn?

The town lies in Kings County, the northwest division of the Brooklyn borough, NYC. It is a part of the Brooklyn Community District 2, including Brooklyn Heights, DUMBO, Vinegar Hill, Fulton Mall, Boerum Hill, Fort Greene, Brooklyn Navy Yard, Fulton Ferry, and Clinton Hill.

The Manhattan Bridge connects the town to Canal Street and Lower Manhattan. And Brooklyn Bridge directly to NYC.

Find rooms for rent in Downtown Brooklyn

Find Rooms For Rent In Downtown Brooklyn

When looking for rooms for rent in Downtown Brooklyn, remember that it’s similar to any megalopolis. So, shopping, nightlife, entertainment, education, commerce, media, civic and public offices are here in abundance. DB includes Brooklyn Heights, DUMBO, Cobble Hill, Boerum Hill, Fort Greene, Clinton Hill, and the Navy Yard.

For people who enjoy the nightlife, Downtown Brooklyn, Williamsburg, Gowanus and Park Slope are great areas. Whereas Park Slope, Cobble Hill/Carroll Gardens, Windsor Terrace, Bay Ridge, and Greenwood are best for families. And places like Bushwick, Williamsburg, and Clinton Hill, along with Bed-Stuy and Crown Heights, are places that will suit millennials.

Related: How to Find Apartments in Brooklyn to Rent

Average rent in Downtown Brooklyn

It’s good to know your needs before you go looking for rooms for rent in Downtown Brooklyn. Do you need parking space, nearby public transit, a calm locale, or plenty of nightlife? Top floor, ground, or basement? Will you share or rent alone?

For instance, Brooklyn Heights, the priciest of all residential neighborhoods, comprises fashionable buildings and historical architecture. Its high cost is largely down to its views of the Lower Manhattan skyline. DUMBO and Boerum Hill are also expensive areas, if you’re feeling fancy.

Cobble Hill is a quaint Italian neighborhood and offers excellent bars with great pizzerias. In addition, bookstores, retail stores, and neighborhood pubs make this an interesting area.

Crown Heights has several parks, a botanical garden, four museums, and several landmark locations. It comprises a mix of cultures and, due to these reasons, has various recreational and entertainment options.

Starting your journey with an understanding of what you want will really narrow down the search and save time…time you can spend enjoying this exciting area.

Related: Find Rooms for Rent in Brooklyn, NY

Is Downtown Brooklyn safe?

Most places are safe, but safety lies in good sense and it’s important to practise caution – don’t venture out alone at night! That said, downtown is safer than many other NYC neighborhoods. That’s partly because of the many busy restaurants in Downtown Brooklyn that stay open late. It’s always a smart idea to keep helpful numbers on the quick dial in case of any emergencies.

The town is patrolled by the NYPD 84th precinct:

  • Emergency: 911 (Only Fire, Police and Ambulance emergencies).
  • Non-Emergency: 311 (non-emergencies and public enquiries).
NYPD Website

ParkNYC: a convenient way to pay for parking via mobile or the www.

ParkNYC App
ParkMobile App

Downtown Brooklyn Towing Services: for emergency roadside assistance, flat tires, car lockout services, and more, contact (646) 460-2444.

Website

Public transit in Downtown Brooklyn

The Metropolitan Transportation Authority (MTA) is the largest transportation network. The NYC subway station is famous not only for its complexity but also for cultural influences – from video games, movies, music to comic books and television. Know your way around before you go looking for rooms for rent in Downtown Brooklyn.

1. Walkability in Downtown Brooklyn

With a walk score of 96, this is a great place to stroll, jog, run, or bike. Also, daily errands are easily accomplished on foot.

2. Roads & traffic in Downtown Brooklyn

NYC is known for its regular traffic congestions, and it’s almost always rush hour in DB. We recommend that you use the public transportation available as much as possible. Be aware of covid-19 protocols!

3. Nearby train stations in Downtown Brooklyn

The subway station system in NYC takes some getting used to. The main stations in DB are:

  • Atlantic Ave-Barclays Center/Pacific St.
  • Borough Hall.
  • Clark St., nearest to Brooklyn Bridge.
Moovit Website

4. Nearby bus stops in Downtown Brooklyn

Brooklyn has comprehensive bus coverage, so you can usually count on the service you need to get around.

Due to the pandemic, there are regular service interruptions. We recommend you see the MTA Brooklyn Bus Schedules for real-time service updates.

Related: Hacks To The Subway In NYC We All Need

Restaurants in Downtown Brooklyn

There are many restaurants in Downtown Brooklyn offering various cuisines. We’ve selected three for you to try while you explore the area.

1. Paulie Gee’s Slice Shop

For the infamous NYC pizza slice, visit the Paulie Gee’s Slice Shop before, after, or while looking for rooms for rent in Downtown Brooklyn. It has delivery, takeout, and indoor seating available.

Visit the website
Order Now!

2. Bedouin Tent

Out of the many restaurants in Downtown Brooklyn, this is a gem, serving excellent Middle Eastern cuisine. Ask for seating, and they’ll usher you into a Bedouin Tent. Enjoy reasonably priced, well-sized portions of freshly prepared pitas and meats with greens and drinks. They also have vegan options.

Order online

3. DeKalb Market Hall

Many great restaurants in Downtown Brooklyn are collected here. You’ll find Thai, Polish, Chinese, American, Pakistani, and Japanese all under one bustling roof. A great place to stop and consider the rooms for rent in Downtown Brooklyn.

Website

Parks in Downtown Brooklyn

After a busy day looking at rooms for rent in Downtown Brooklyn, you’ll want to find some great spots to relax in. We’ll give details for a few and list others to check out.

  • Brooklyn Bridge Park: located at the waterfront in the park under Brooklyn Bridge. It has seating steps and picnic spots, which offer beautiful views of NYC.
  • Rockwell Place Community Garden: near the Max Morris Dance Center, stop here to stroll, read a book, or enjoy the flowers. The Garden also hosts seasonal and regular events.
  • Columbus Park: hosts the green market from April to December. Sit and enjoy a snack and coffee at one of the few restaurants in Downtown Brooklyn here. Head here for a calm place to relax after a busy day looking at rooms for rent in Downtown Brooklyn.
  • Walt Whitman Park.
  • Fort Greene Park.
  • 16 Sycamores Playground.
  • Betty Carter Park.
  • McLaughlin Park.
  • Willoughby Square “Pop-Up” Park.
  • Cadman Plaza Park.
  • Commodore Barry Park.

Recreational activities

Visit the many plazas in DB that host dance, arts, and cultural programs, along with theater rehearsals and community fitness projects. In addition to recreational activities, you’ll get to know more about the city and meet like-minded people.

  • The Plaza at 300 Ashland: The large expanse of space provides ample room for gatherings to enjoy markets, festivals, and community events.
  • Atlantic Terminal Plaza: comprises five floors with the lower accommodating offices, and upper floors with stores such as Target, Victoria Secret, and more.
  • Hoyt Plaza: a relaxing spot in busy DB to rest and enjoy landscaped pedestrian-friendly spaces.
  • Willoughby Plaza: another great place to shop, eat, and enjoy DB.
  • Albee Square: next to City Point, this plaza hosts fashion shows, concerts, outdoor movies, block parties, and other events.
  • Fox Square: people from Fort Greene and Downtown Brooklyn come together here to enjoy common interests.

Related: Things To Do In Brooklyn With Your Roommates!

D’you know what else Roomi does outside of helping its readers find rooms for rent in Downtown Brooklyn? With our ever-increasing lists of rooms and roommates across the world, we help you find your perfect match!

DOWNLOAD THE APP NOW!
